SEARCH
Package io.avery.conveyor

Interface Belt.Stage

All Known Subinterfaces:
Belt.Sink<In>, Belt.Source<Out>, Belt.Station, Belt.StepSink<In>, Belt.StepSource<Out>
All Known Implementing Classes:
ProxySink, ProxySource
Enclosing class:
Belt
public static sealed interface Belt.Stage permits Belt.Source<Out>, Belt.Sink<In>, Belt.Station
Sealed interface over Source, Sink, and Station. Stages have different input/output configurations, or "shapes", which can be connected to form a processing pipeline.
  • Source - yields output elements
  • Sink - accepts input elements
  • Station - connects Sources to Sinks
(For a "stage" that accepts input elements and yields output elements, see Segue.)

Stages can be run, which will traverse each station enclosed by the stage and concurrently drain sources to sinks.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    default void
    run(Executor executor)
    Executes each station enclosed by this stage.

  • Method Details

    • run

      default void run(Executor executor)
      Executes each station enclosed by this stage. Execution proceeds by recursively running the source and sink of the station, and submitting a task to the executor that:
      1. drains the source to the sink
      2. completes the sink normally if no exception was thrown
      3. closes the source
      4. completes the sink abruptly if an exception was thrown, suppressing further exceptions

      If any of steps 1-3 throw an exception, the initial exception will be caught and wrapped in a CompletionException thrown at the end of the task.

      If the initial exception is an InterruptedException, or if any completions throw InterruptedException, the thread interrupt status will be set when the exception is caught, and will remain set until any subsequent throw of InterruptedException. (This ensures that recovery operators see the interrupt, and do not unintentionally interfere with interrupt responsiveness.)

      The given executor should ideally spawn a new thread for each task. An executor with insufficient threads to run all enclosed stations concurrently may cause deadlock.

      If a station has already started running on any executor, subsequent runs of that station will short-circuit and do nothing.

      Parameters:
      executor - the executor to submit tasks to
      Implementation Requirements
      A stage that delegates to other stages should call run on each stage before returning from this method.

      The default implementation does nothing.
